articles.title: How Google Cloud is shaping the enterprise AI inference moment
articles.description: Enterprise technology investment continues to accelerate, but the friction point has shifted. The hard part is no longer training models or selecting architectures. It’s getting those models into production, keeping them responsive under real-world conditions and proving they deliver value once they’re live. AI inference is where initiatives either prove their value or grind to […] The post How Google Cloud is shaping the enterprise AI inference moment appeared first on SiliconANGLE.

articles.title: AI agent-driven browser automation for enterprise workflow management
articles.description: Enterprise organizations increasingly rely on web-based applications for critical business processes, yet many workflows remain manually intensive, creating operational inefficiencies and compliance risks. Despite significant technology investments, knowledge workers routinely navigate between eight to twelve different web applications during standard workflows, constantly switching contexts and manually transferring information between systems. Data entry and validation tasks […]

articles.title: Faster agents, bigger blast radius: Why agent governance is the new control plane for resilience
articles.description: As enterprises accelerate their move toward autonomous workflows powered by artificial intelligence, the urgent need for robust AI agent governance has become a critical operational mandate. An agent’s potential relies on the fact that they can perform higher-level tasks, including assuming identities and executing business processes. But if that is compromised, attackers have effectively hijacked […] The post Faster agents, bigger blast radius: Why agent governance is the new control plane for...

articles.title: Anthropic announces Bloom, an open-source tool for researchers evaluating AI behavior
articles.description: Anthropic PBC Friday announced the release of Bloom, an open-source agentic framework for defining and exploring the behavior of frontier artificial intelligence models. Bloom takes a researcher-specified behavior and evaluates its frequency and severity by preparing scenarios to elicit and test for it. It’s designed to help speed up the tedious process of developing and […] The post Anthropic announces Bloom, an open-source tool for researchers evaluating AI behavior appeared first on...

articles.title: Deploy Mistral AI’s Voxtral on Amazon SageMaker AI
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate hosting Voxtral models on Amazon SageMaker AI endpoints using vLLM and the Bring Your Own Container (BYOC) approach. vLLM is a high-performance library for serving large language models (LLMs) that features paged attention for improved memory management and tensor parallelism for distributing models across multiple GPUs.
articles.author: Ying Hou
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate hosting Voxtral models on Amazon SageMaker AI endpoints using vLLM and the Bring Your Own Container (BYOC) approach. vLLM is a high-performance library for serving large language models (LLMs) that features paged attention for improved memory management and tensor parallelism for distributing models across multiple GPUs.

articles.title: Accelerate Enterprise AI Development using Weights & Biases and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate how to use Foundation Models (FMs) from Amazon Bedrock and the newly launched Amazon Bedrock AgentCore alongside W&B Weave to help build, evaluate, and monitor enterprise AI solutions. We cover the complete development lifecycle from tracking individual FM calls to monitoring complex agent workflows in production.
articles.author: James Yi
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate how to use Foundation Models (FMs) from Amazon Bedrock and the newly launched Amazon Bedrock AgentCore alongside W&B Weave to help build, evaluate, and monitor enterprise AI solutions. We cover the complete development lifecycle from tracking individual FM calls to monitoring complex agent workflows in production.

articles.title: Waymo is testing Gemini as an in-car AI assistant in its robotaxis
articles.description: Waymo is testing a Gemini-powered in-car AI assistant, per findings from a 1,200-line system prompt. The assistant can answer general knowledge questions, control certain in-cabin features, and more.
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan
articles.content: Waymo is testing a Gemini-powered in-car AI assistant, per findings from a 1,200-line system prompt. The assistant can answer general knowledge questions, control certain in-cabin features, and more.

articles.title: HP leaks OMEN OLED gaming monitors ahead of CES 2026
articles.description: HP HyperX plans to unveil a new OMEN OLED monitor lineup at CES 2026, with details leaked by Windows Latest. Three models receive specifications: OMEN OLED 34, OMEN OLED 27qs, and OMEN OLED 27q. No resolutions appear in the leak. Sources cited by Windows Latest describe these as “the best gaming monitors HP has ever […]

articles.title: Build a multimodal generative AI assistant for root cause diagnosis in predictive maintenance using Amazon Bedrock
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate how to implement a predictive maintenance solution using Foundation Models (FMs) on Amazon Bedrock, with a case study of Amazon's manufacturing equipment within their fulfillment centers. The solution is highly adaptable and can be customized for other industries, including oil and gas, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare.
articles.author: Carla Lorente
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate how to implement a predictive maintenance solution using Foundation Models (FMs) on Amazon Bedrock, with a case study of Amazon's manufacturing equipment within their fulfillment centers. The solution is highly adaptable and can be customized for other industries, including oil and gas, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare.

articles.title: NIH-led study reveals role of mobile DNA elements in lung cancer progression
articles.description: Sherlock-Lung study researchers use large-scale, multi-omics analysis to identify biomarker of aggressive lung tumors.
articles.content: Sherlock-Lung study researchers use large-scale, multi-omics analysis to identify biomarker of aggressive lung tumors.

articles.title: Migrate MLflow tracking servers to Amazon SageMaker AI with serverless MLflow
articles.description: This post shows you how to migrate your self-managed MLflow tracking server to a MLflow App – a serverless tracking server on SageMaker AI that automatically scales resources based on demand while removing server patching and storage management tasks at no cost. Learn how to use the MLflow Export Import tool to transfer your experiments, runs, models, and other MLflow resources, including instructions to validate your migration's success.
articles.author: Rahul Easwar
articles.content: This post shows you how to migrate your self-managed MLflow tracking server to a MLflow App – a serverless tracking server on SageMaker AI that automatically scales resources based on demand while removing server patching and storage management tasks at no cost. Learn how to use the MLflow Export Import tool to transfer your experiments, runs, models, and other MLflow resources, including instructions to validate your migration's success.

articles.title: Report: OpenAI explores ways to make money from ChatGPT with conversational ads
articles.description: Artificial intelligence industry darling OpenAI Group PBC is reportedly mulling the idea of embedding advertisements into ChatGPT’s responses amid pressure from investors to start making money from the chatbot. A report in The Information today suggests that OpenAI is already exploring possible ad formats and partnerships, with one of the favorite ideas being to integrate […] The post Report: OpenAI explores ways to make money from ChatGPT with conversational ads appeared first on SiliconANGLE.
